output.conclusion: Upon completion of this course, you will have a foundational understanding of basic nursing procedures, enabling you to assist in patient care under supervision.
output.introduction: Welcome to Basic Nursing Procedures! This course is designed for beginners and will introduce you to essential skills for assisting in patient care. Each module is designed to take approximately 10 minutes to read.

chapters.description: Overview of the nursing profession, roles and responsibilities of a nurse, ethical considerations, and patient rights.
Handwashing techniques, personal protective equipment (PPE) usage, and maintaining a clean environment.
Understanding body temperature, methods of measurement (oral, axillary, tympanic), and normal ranges.

modules.moduleTitle: Introduction to Nursing and Basic Hygiene

chapters.description: Measuring pulse rate and rhythm, assessing respiratory rate and depth, and normal ranges.
Understanding blood pressure, using a sphygmomanometer, and normal ranges.
Common patient positions (supine, prone, lateral, Fowler's), and their uses.
Preparing patients for meals, assisting with feeding, and documenting intake.
Recording fluid intake and output, and understanding its importance.
Techniques for making an unoccupied bed and occupied bed.
